name: Notice of Proceedings NOP JAE1 (JOINT APPLICATION)
body:
Case reference number: ((reference number))

#Notice of proceedings

Dear ((first name)) ((last name)),

Your joint ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) has been checked by court staff and accepted. Your case reference number is: ((reference number)). A separate email has been sent to your ((partner)) confirming this. 

#What you need to do 
You need to acknowledge receipt of this email, so the court knows you have received and read it. You do this by signing into your ((isDivorce??divorce account))((isDissolution??account to end your civil partnership)): ((signin url)) 

#What happens next
 The next step in the ((isDivorce??divorce process))((isDissolution??process to end your civil partnership)) is to confirm that you want the application to continue by applying for a 'conditional order'. You have to wait until ((date of response)) until you can apply. You will receive an email to remind you then. 

You can use the time between now and then to decide how the money and property is divided. You can also make arrangements for children, if you have them. Dividing money and property is dealt with separately to the ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)).

#Dividing your money and property
It’s usually more straightforward and less expensive if you agree with your ((partner)) on how to divide your money and property. Get help agreeing: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/mediation

If you do agree then you can make the agreement legally binding. This is known as asking the court to make a ‘consent order’. Read more about consent orders: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/apply-for-consent-order

If you disagree then you can ask the court to decide for you. This is known as applying for a ‘financial order’. Read more about financial orders: https://www.gov.uk/money-property-when-relationship-ends/get-court-to-decide

((isDivorce??Divorce service))((isDissolution??End a civil partnership service))
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday 8am to 8pm, Saturday 8am to 2pm)
Email: ((court email))

This is an automated message, please do not reply to this email.

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email.
